name: Kepler-426
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-426 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-426 is a star with 0.91 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.92 times its radius. It is located 2870.1728 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 6 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-426 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-426 system

Kepler-426 b

Kepler-426 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the Transit method. The mass of Kepler-426 b is 108.06 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-426 b is 12.22 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-426 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-426 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-426, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
